narrative.title: 51St Highland Infantry Division - 1942Q4

operations.name: Second Battle of El Alamein (Operation Lightfoot)
operations.role: Breakthrough assault on northern sector, 'break-in' and 'crumbling' phases
operations.outcome: Success - achieved breakthrough despite heavy casualties (~2,000), maintained pressure on Axis forces

operations.name: Kidney Ridge Actions
operations.role: Assault and defense of Kidney Ridge feature during El Alamein 'crumbling' operations
operations.outcome: Success - held vital ground against Axis counterattacks

operations.name: Pursuit into Libya
operations.role: Follow-up operations pursuing retreating Axis forces
operations.outcome: Ongoing - advanced westward after Axis retreat

situation.combat_effectiveness: Good - Division performed well in first battle at El Alamein despite being green troops. Major-General Wimberley's leadership and emphasis on Highland identity created strong esprit de corps. Night assault tactics effective. Casualties of ~2,000 (11% of strength) reflect aggressive operations.

narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.
